turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Fisherman (American horse).
turn.1: What was the most successful race of the year for the American horse, Fisherman?
turn.2: Fisherman (American horse)  Fisherman (foaled 1951 in Kentucky) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse.
turn.4: Fisherman was bred and raced by Cornelius Vanderbilt Whitney, a member of the prominent horse-racing Whitney family.
turn.6: He was out of the mare Crawfish and sired by Whitney's Phalanx, the winner of the 1947 Belmont Stakes voted American Champion Three-Year-Old Male Horse.
turn.8: Fisherman was trained by future U.S. Racing Hall of Fame inductee, Sylvester Veitch.
turn.9: What is something notable about the horse's early career?
turn.10: Sent to the racetrack at age two, Fisherman won a number of races for his age group including the important Champagne Stakes.
turn.11: Did the horse win any awards or titles?
turn.12: Despite Fisherman's performances in 1953, in the balloting for American Champion Two-Year-Old Colt he finished behind Hasty Road in one major poll and Porterhouse in the other two.
